newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat says it sold Alcatel-Alsthom stake.
newsitem.headline: Fiat says it sold Alcatel-Alsthom stake.

text.p: Italy's Fiat group said it had sold its 1.9 pct stake in Alcatel Alsthom to Societe Generale and that it expected to make a gross capital gain of around 200 billion lire on the sale.
Fiat said in a statement the group had sold 3,099,759 Alcatel Alsthom shares on Thursday, representing around 1.9 percent of the French company's capital, to Societe Generale bank.
It said the operation, which had been agreed with Alcatel Alsthom, marked Fiat's exit from the firm's capital following the exit by Alcatel from Fiat's capital last year.
The deal, worth around two billion French francs, or some 590 billion lire, "allows the Fiat Group to realise a gross consolidated capital gain of around 200 billion lire," the statement added.
Earlier in Paris on Thursday, market sources said French brokerage Delahaye, a unit of Societe Generale, was placing three million Alcatel Alsthom shares at 647 francs per share.
The seller was rumoured to be Fiat but a spokeswoman at Fiat France denied the company was selling Alcatel shares.
